Assignment 6 Jes Braun 2/26/2021 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandocs Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/. THIS IS MY ATTEMPT AT R MARKDOWN I know what I am doing
Chapter 2 How I built my database 2.1 This is what my code looked like 2.2 This is my schema

Chapter 2 How I built my database My database is not very fancy because it is all imaginary data at this time. I used SQLite Studio to build my tables and linked them with Primary Keys. You can find that database here. I couldnt figure out how to link the foreign keys, so acknowledge that gap in my database 2.1 This is what my code looked like CREATE TABLE plant_list ( latin_name char(50), common_name varchar(50), PRIMARY KEY (common_name) ); CREATE TABLE functional_traits ( latin_name varchar(50), growth_rate numb(10), root_length numb(10), horizontal_spread numb(10), PRIMARY KEY (growth_rate) ); CREATE TABLE plant_groups ( latin_name varchar(50), wetland_indicator_status varchar(10), life_cycle varchar(50), dormancy_breaking_strategy varchar(50), PRIMARY KEY (wetland_indicator_status) ); CREATE TABLE seed_collection ( plant_id varchar(50), latin_name char(50), collection_site varchar(10), name_collector char(10), date_collected numb(10), PRIMARY KEY (collection_site) ); CREATE TABLE seed_coating ( plant_id varchar(50), coating_type varchar(10), latin_name char(50), plant_date numb(10), PRIMARY KEY (coating_type) ); CREATE TABLE research_plots ( plot_name char(50), plant_id varchar(50), longitude numb(50), latitude numb(50), PRIMARY KEY (plot_name) ); 2.2 This is my schema bold= primary key. Unique id for each record in that table Italics = foreign key, a variable shared between tables
